captions.text:
- That doesn't surprise me at
all, I'm terrified about it.
Let's hear, how bad was it?

- [Voiceover] Would
you put your ear on it?
- No.
- No.
- No, that's disgusting.
No, I, actually, I'm a huge germophobe

so I can't even, this
is freaking me about.
- My name's William DePaolo.

I'm an assistant professor
at the University
of Southern California in the department
of Molecular Microbiology and Immunology.
We decided to test out the hypothesis
that toilet seats are not as dirty

as probably an object
that you're using everyday
which would be your cellphone.
We took employees here at BuzzFeed,

took their phones and we
swabbed them for bacteria
and compared it to a toilet.

We cultured them on plates,
put them in an incubator,

and 24 hours later we analyzed
them to identify different
types of bacteria and fungus.

What we found was that the
toilet which is seen here,

had about three different
types of bacteria
and fungal species on them.

The cellphone is much more
dirty than the toilet.

There are a number of
more species of bacteria.
The toilet had three, the cellphones had
on average 10 to 12.

They also had a lot worse
types of bacteria on them.

E. coli was present, we also
even found fecal bacteria.

We have a situation where fecal
bacteria were on the phones,
not even on the toilet seat.
The toilet bowl was cleaner?
Oh, that's so gross.
Ohhhh.

I'm on my phone all the time,
I am always using my phone.

I'm just not going to have
to use my phone any more.
- How is that possible though?
People poop on them all day.
I don't poop on my phone.

The minute you took my
phone I was paranoid

and now I know why, I just,
I'm right to live in fear

for the rest of my life
because everything's covered
in booger germs.

- Ew, I need to wipe
down my phone right now.
I'm like sweating because I'm nervous.
What?

I don't understand how
there's so much crap
on my phone.

Here the whole time I
thought it was fingerprints.
It's... that.
E. coli.
- I will gladly take this off
and run to a hazmat.
I don't know, where am I supposed to go?
Where am I supposed to go now?

title: How Much $#!T Is On Your Phone?

Why are people so surprised that toilet seats are pretty clean? The only 
thing that ever touches them is your butt. You are always wearing pants 
that cover your butt so it won't touch anything else that is germy. And all

phones are germy because you hold them with your hands which aren't covered 
most of the time so they do touch other gross stuff. ﻿

comments.text:
That makes sense because what does toilet seats touch? Just your 
buttcheeks. Not your actual asshole and poo, not even near it (if you sit 
normally...) And what does your butt touch? Just the inside of your 
(hopefully) clean underpants which also are protected by (probably) your 
pants.
Well then...what does your phone touch? Your hands, your face (that's been 
exposed to EVERYTHING around you, including buses and such) other peoples 
hands and faces (if you lend it out), ALL the surfaces you put your phone 
down on (outdoors, indoors, tables, benches, you name it)
And ALSO, how often do you clean your butt and toiletseat in comparison to 
your phone? Think about that. (I almost never clean my phone, but I shower 
my butt regularly). ^^﻿
